revised_title: Experimental Researches on Induced Magneto-Electric Current and Magnetic Forces
tldr: In this series of experiments, Michael Faraday investigates the induced magneto-electric current as a measure of magnetic forces. He demonstrates the principles and practices necessary for this purpose, including the use of a galvanometer to measure the induced electric current. Faraday also explores the effects of thermo-electric currents and the influence of temperature on the instrument. His findings contribute to the understanding of electromagnetic induction and the behavior of magnetic forces.
